visual_desc: EXT. RUINS DAIS - DAWN. Wide shot. The sun breaks weakly over the ravaged continent. <Queen Sera> stands alone on a newly consecrated, clean stone dais carved from the ruins. She slowly lifts a new crown—thinner, simpler, made of bright SILVER—and places it upon her head. Her face is a mask of profound sorrow overlaid with unbreakable resolve. She looks up toward the weak sunrise.
variation_reason: Compared to the first frame, there are only minor changes in the composition. The primary change is the action of the commanding leader putting on the crown and shifting their gaze.
